newsitem.title: USA: York sees 40-50 pct EPS rise in fiscal 1997.
newsitem.headline: York sees 40-50 pct EPS rise in fiscal 1997.

text.p: York Research Corp said it expects its February 1997 fiscal year share earnings to rise between 40 percent and 50 percent over prior-year share earnings of $0.35.
The increase is due to expansion in North America commodity marketing and power project development operations.
The increased earnings are expected to be on revenues of about $40 million, compared with $14 million in fiscal 1996, the company said.
As part of its North American expansion, York also said it acquired 85 percent of the common stock of North American Energy Conservation Inc, a wholesale power marketer.
Terms of the acquisition were not disclosed.
The company could not be reached for comment at this time.
